17473218.review:
https://youtu.be/I3kqzf06T5k

Hören, bauen, spielen – das ist das Motto von Circuits, einem Spiel von dem spanischen Entwicklerstudio Digital Tentacle.

In diesem Spiel ist es Deine Aufgabe, vorgegebene, zerstückelte Musiktitel wieder zusammenzusetzen. Davon gibt es ganze 25 Stück mit steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad und wachsenden Optionen. In zukünftigen Updates werden weitere Levels hinzugefügt werden.

Während die ersten Levels Dich kontinuierlich an die verschiedenen Funktionen einzeln heranführen, wirst Du in höheren Levels viele Funktionen und Schalter kombinieren müssen, um das Level zu erfolgreich zu beenden.

Dein musikalisches Gehör ist bei diesem Spiel besonders gefragt. Für geübte und ungeübte Ohren sind die meisten Levels kein Problem, dann gibt es da aber auch solche Stellen, an denen sich Option eins kaum von Option zwei unterschiedet. Auch Folgefehler in langen Ketten können kurzfristig frustrierend sein.

Diese Stellen tun dem Spielspaß jedoch keinen Abbruch. Mit schönen Sounds sowie einem schicken, minimalistischen Design ist Circuits eine empfehlenswerte Abwechslung für Zwischendurch.

Circuits ist bei Steam für 4,99 Euro erhältlich und beinhaltet das Spiel sowie einen Musikeditor – auch Circuits Editor oder Circuits Composer genannt – mit dem sich schnell eigene Soundtracks erstellen und exportieren lassen. Zum Zeitpunkt dieses Reviews befand sich Circuits Composer noch in einer BETA-Version, sodass einzelne Funktionen wie eine noch umfangreichere Soundbibliothek sowie die Steam-Workshop-Integration noch nicht getestet werden konnten.

Circuits Composer knüpft mit einem ähnlichen Design sowie ähnlichen Sounds an das Spiel Circuits an und wird zukünftig auch noch erweitert werden können.

Von mir gibt es für Circuits sowie den Circuits Composer eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●

Listen, build, play - that is the motto of circuits, a game by the Spanish developer-studio Digital Tentacle.

In this game, it is your task to assemble predetermined, fragmented songs again. There are whole 25 levels with increasing difficulty and growing options. They will add more levels in the future.

While the first levels continuously individually bring you to the different functions, you will need to combine many functions and switches in higher levels to successfully complete the level.

Your musical ear is particularly in demand in this game. For trained and untrained ears, the most levels are not a problem, but there are also such places where option one is similar to option two. Also messing in long chains can be frustrating in the short term.

These places do but not diminish the fun. With beautiful sounds, as well as a beautiful and minimalist design Circuits is a recommended variety for in between.

Circuits is available on steam for €4.99 and includes the game and a music editor –called also Circuits Editor or Circuits Composer – himself quickly own soundtracks create and export will allow. At the time of this review Circuits Composer was still in a BETA version, so that individual functions such as an even more extensive sound library and the Steam workshop integration could not yet be tested.

Circuits Composer alludes to the game of circuits with a similar design and similar sounds and can be expanded in the future even.

I recommend to purchase Circuits, as well as the Circuits Composer!

Definitely an interesting musical experience fuzed with minimalistic interface.  Depending on the player's musical ear will determine the puzzle's difficulty.  I would recommend this game for anyone that appreciates musical composition and eloquent ear training puzzles.

Edit: The Circuits Composer mode was a free update and essentially an entirely different branch of this game.  For those that like the music from Circuits, now they can take sound bytes (either from the game or just similar sounds from the game's composer) and piece them together with a simple yet limited GUI.  This is probalby the equivilance of what Windows Movie Maker is in the video editing world.  Although limited, it's pretty easy to create some simple electronic ambient background music.

If musical puzzles or simple electronic music creation is what you want, I'd recommend Circuits a go.

16786019.review:
Circuits is one of those increasingly-popular, sleek, simplistic puzzle games, with very simple (yet complex) concepts that grow as you play. Similar to LYNE, Splice, SpaceChem, KAMI, or Perfection., Circuits is polished to perfection, very easy on the eyes, and EXTREMELY easy on the ears. Circuits has one of the best soundtracks of any puzzle game ever, and for good reason: the gameplay revolves around the music. The object of the game is to construct certain songs piece by piece, by listening to the full thing in sequence, and then doing your best to remember what it sounded like. It gets more and more complex as you go, as it has very nice progression. It stays entertaining as it introduces new methods of completing increasingly difficult and complex songs, such as looping certain clips. My only complaint is the difficulty and length: it starts way too easy for the first 10 levels, and then hops up the difficulty quite a bit. But after that it has beautiful progression. It also only took me 85 minutes to complete, but since it's so enjoyable to listen to the music and such a pristine and refreshing experience, the shortness doesn't matter that much; I played through it one and a half more times before I got bored. Also since it only costs $4.99, it's a great deal even for an hour-and-a-half-long game! (especially if you get it on sale) Circuits is a little gem that went unnoticed by most. If you like sleekly designed and simplistic puzzle games and love good, crisp music, then don't hesitate any longer: get Circuits!

8.0/10

16746393.review:
[h1]A Paladin’s Steam Review: Circuits. Challenging yet Relaxing Short Rhythm Game[/h1]
[list]
[*]Genre: Minimalist Audio Puzzler
[*]Developed and Published by: Digital Tentacle
[*]Platform: Windows, MacOSX, Linux and iOS. 
[*]Business Model: Base Game.
[*][i]Copy Purchased by Myself[/i] 
[/list]
[b]Game Overview[/b]
The main mechanic of Circuits is a pseudo circuit board play field with spots to place circles. These circles are individual beats or sounds that you have to put in the right order and time to match the original song. Each spot has a symbol to give you a clue as to which circles goes there. You’ve also got the option to listen to individual levels of the music: the beats, the melody and the harmony. Once you think you’ve got it, you’ll play the track in full and see if the game agrees with your solution. There’s no leaderboards, not a lot of achievements nor any difficulty sliders. It’s just a casual rhythm game to enjoy, which I did. It was satisfying to figure out how each song worked within the context of Circuits. It’s an overall neat idea and keeping it as short as they did was a smart move on their part. 

[b]Audio Puzzle Difficulty[/b]
There’s twenty five tracks in total that you can solve at your own pace. They slowly ramp up in difficulty over time as new mechanics are introduced but it’ll never get overly difficult to figure out a solution. You’re also given tips every level that’ll help you out of a tough spot. I found that I could complete Circuits without needing to look online for solutions. It just takes some patience and quite a few listenings. 

[b]Circuits Composer[/b]
There’s a composer track editor included with Circuits to allow you to make your own tracks. It’s more of a really lightweight version of Audacity. All you can do is drag pre-recorded tracks from the library and stick them on a 8-track board. You can’t add or subtract tracks, you can’t play around with fading, crossfading or any other number of audio fiddling options. It’s more of a causal editor that will let you slap a song together in a short amount of time. There’s plenty of music to choose from in the library and no doubt you could make some unique stuff with it. Just don’t expect a full version of Garageband. It’s a neat little feature for people who’re casually interested in messing around.  

[b]PC Settings Menu[/b]
All settings are in the pre-game launcher. It’s the standard Unity setup of resolution options, fullscreen and windowed, graphics quality slider and keybindings. There’s really not a lot to comment on here because it’s not a graphically demanding game nor is there any reason to really play around with any of the settings. Since the game is mouse driven, you won’t be changing any of the keybindings either. The UI is minimalist but functional. I didn’t experience any performance problems or crashing during my time with Circuits. It felt rock solid the entire time. 

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
For a couple of hours, you’ll get a fun little audio/rhythm puzzle game that can be rather tricky to solve. You’ll need a good pair headphones or speakers to get the full enjoyment out of this title. The soundtrack’s moody electronic and orchestral-like sounds are rather enjoyable. But I have really weird tastes so keep that in mind. I haven’t got any complaints about it and if you’re looking for a casual rhythm game, Circuits fills that niche quite nicely. 

[url=http://kingisaaclinksr.com/2015/06/27/a-paladins-steam-review-circuits-challenging-yet-relaxing-short-rhythm-game/]Read this review and more on A Paladin Without A Crusade[/url]

16523397.review:
之前看别人推荐，立刻就产生兴趣来玩玩。流程很短，三小时通关来写点感想。

优点无需多言，这是款真正的“音乐”游戏。A real music game:)
为什么这么说，和大多数通过音乐来打节奏的音游不同的是，这是个玩音乐本身的游戏。
“混音。”
游戏设计的理念是极好的，让玩家自己动手拼合音乐，25关不同的优美旋律也足以提现作曲者的深厚功底。光是这两点，就足以推荐给喜欢音乐的玩家了。

曲子方面，总体很赞，个别地方拼接得有点突兀。加了特技，耳机党福利。

设计方面，不得不说还有许多不完善的地方。
首先，分层设计不完善。从编曲层面讲，理应每类音色分一层，游戏并没有明确划分，也没给任何说明就弄了一堆不同种类的音乐片段，不够清晰。因为分的层太少，导致同一个层有时是鼓点，有时又变成弦乐，有时直接把重要旋律放到干路，感觉只是在点缀音乐而不是拼凑音乐。
第二，难度设计不完善。因为分层设计的不完善，导致合并听太乱容易搞混，并没有难到点子上。然而分开听又过于简单，不是高度音痴应该都没问题。。
第三，玩法设计不完善。虽然游戏中变更了一些玩法，选loop次数和支路，但实质却是一样的= =，三小时流程中全是在照着原曲选择对应放法中度过的，久了就变成听曲子的游戏了。有时候感觉错误的片段也挺不错，毕竟音乐不是绝对的，但却有更好的，以作曲者的能力，为何不简单设计点不能听原曲自己选择更合适的和弦和节奏什么的进阶关卡，让玩家去融入到“制作”环节，加深游戏理念，玩法和挑战性也能得到提升。

综上我只能给个中评，作为音乐爱好者，本着支持这类游戏和支持小作坊的态度给好评了，期待能有更多这类游戏。当然并非专业人士，如果评得不好见谅。

最后吐个槽，为啥不少不错的曲子又短又不持久刚听到高潮就完了。。

16400041.review: Not what I expected this to be. I was hoping the first few levels were just a tutorial set up for something bigger, but rather than the circuit concept being something exciting and more complex like Spacechem and Sokobond, it's essentially a game where you have to place samples into the correct place in a totally linear manner without much having to perform much else. This alone is tedious enough without an annoying message at the end of a long piece telling you "You got it wrong" in the most frustrating and flat way, and not giving any sort of incentive to be creative or want to keep at it, as there is only one correct solution. There's not so much a feeling of puzzle solving and reward as there is of doing the chore and continuing on to the next similar sounding 'chore' without any promise of something greater. Was hoping it would have expanded a bit more on musicality and intuitive solutions rather than having to sit listening to a whole track just to find out one thing is slightly off. The music is not very expansive at all either - what's there is good, but it really doesn't deviate from the 'chill electronic' theme. I was hoping for a lot more to be honest. The trailer sells this game a little better than it actually is, avoid.

16324736.review:
[h1]A relaxing music puzzler[/h1]
25 levels of putting different audio snippets in the correct place to complete the music tracks. I played Circuits a level or two at a time, just before I went to sleep and really enjoyed the experience. 8/10

[u][b]Pros: [/b][/u]
+ A refreshingly different experience from blowing stuff up or hack n slash. Also surprisingly relaxing.
+ Designed for headphones, great quality audio with depth and width. Some of the tunes are quite beautiful.
+ Game mechanics gradually introduced, never overwhelming.
+ Small indie devs working on a free music composer as an addition to this game. I suspect some people might have even more fun with the composer than the actual game itself. It has huge potential.

[u][b]Cons: [/b][/u]
- Gets a bit repetitive if played in long sessions.
- Ending is just a one page thank-you note. No victory tune or credit roll or anything.
- Game difficulty depends on how good your ears are, there are no difficulty settings. I found the first 23 levels very straightforward because each tune can be split into different tracks to isolate individual sounds. The last 2 levels remove this feature to increase the difficulty. Now I like a good challenge and have a decent pair of ears but I found it impossible to pick out some sounds because they were completely masked by other, much louder sounds. I resorted to guessing and using the hint system.  
:(

16227722.review:
So guys,
Today, I was terribly bored and don't know what game I should play. So, I checked my library and found some games I never played before (those are gifts, actually).
And then, I downloaded one of those. The name is Circuits. The size is quite small so it didn't need much download time to complete it. I played this game and... hell, this game is awesome.
The game itself is about music puzzle divided to levels. So, the gameplay is simple. First, you listen to the sample music. Then, you'll be served some puzzle with some notes missing. You have to fill the missing note with the tone available. Rearrange it well, and you'll pass!
The graphic is quietly simple, but it bring the game so relaxing to play and give you more concentration at the music.
The gameplay seems too simple, but trust me, this game is not getting you bored. Beware that you have to use earphone and have good sense of listening. I have played it for a while and I get stuck on level 4! (well, that was my level when this review is written, maybe now I am going at igher level)
I really recommend this game for you. If you are looking for game that is relaxing and challenging at the same time, good art, and much of music on it, then this game is for you!

PS. Sorry for some grammar errors. English is not my primary language.﻿

16180571.review: I give this game a 5/5, that is mostly oppinion but if you are musically talented like me, it is a fun and different sort of game.  The game is a puzzle game where the player has to be able to listen to parts of a song and be able to distinguish the different parts of the song so that you can build the song.  Now that may not sound so hard, but later on you start getting parts that may have the slightest difference and there may be 4 or 5 of those.  This can get real tricky when you have to listen to the same five parts over and over just to figure out which one is right.  The player is given a row of circles, each circle plays a different track of the song and you have to build the song with the tracks you are given.  If you misplace a track,  when you go to play the song through, it will bring up a message at the end of the song saying wrong and it will have you try again.  There are 25 levels and each have a great song to go along with them.  If you have a keen eye for making music, you can try their very simple Circuits composer which allows you to take all the parts of the songs of the real game and make your own songs out of them.  Overall I really like the songs that you build in the game, most of them are techno and dubstep songs and there are a few piano and and modern orchestral style songs.  I really have no dislikes other than i think they should add more levels and make it so you can post and play your own creations.  I think this game is worth it to try, it is a different type of puzzle game instead of your typical matching, card, crossword, etc. style games.

16048675.review:
Circuits is a small, sound-based puzzle game that focuses on a player's ability to discern different tones that form part of a piece. The player, in this game, has to use circular modules to correctly assemble the same piece, using certain modifiers as necessary. These modules assume different colors and sounds, and the soundscape is quite diverse, from auto-tuned vocals to elegant piano tidbits.

As of 5/26/15, this game includes 25 reasonably challenging levels that can be made easier through the use of its limited-per-level hints system and its track separation features, but some of these easing mechanics are slowly taken away from the player as the levels get harder to fully challenge the player to discern even the most subtle of tones.

Personally speaking, it takes a strong ear to distinguish certain harmonies in the later levels, where, at a certain point, track selection is revoked, and the player must build the piece holistically, partly by trial and error and partly by the understanding of the development of the piece as the music player progresses. The player is never penalized for taking too long; in fact, part of a feature to do a "practice listen" of the piece (or a track thereof) permits the player to rewind the track and move the music player needle manually.

This calm atmosphere is further evident in the resulting pieces that are formed; one would indubitably not consider them intense pieces like dubstep or hardstyle tracks, but rather easy-listening and occasionally "trippy." As a result, the game is relaxing to play, and is a great change of pace to fast-paced multiplayer games like "Counter-Strike: Global Offensive" and "League of Legends."

That said, I did not encounter many issues with the game, but as its loading screen says, this game is definitely best played with headphones, not only for optimal sound quality, but also for a better opportunity to pick up those subtle sounds that make that thirty-second piece fuller.

This game would be considered "short" by those players who enjoy blazing through games, but it's a small package that's available for cheap, and so I'd call it good value (Full disclosure: I did purchase this while it was on sale). I played this small game over a period of time, and when I played it, I always felt a sense of tranquility associated with solving puzzles and enjoying listening to the bite-sized musical compositions the game had to offer.

While a "fit-the-objects"-style puzzle game is nothing new (jigsaw puzzles, the Web game "Electric Box," "Tetris"), this game is unique in its smooth execution of blending sound and "fit-the-objects" gameplay together.

In conclusion, I'd wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone who has an appreciation for music in general, anyone with an interest in somewhat unconventional puzzles, and everyone else who's somewhere between those two groups. It's a relaxing, lovely-sounding game that essentially commands the player to appreciate the sounds surrounding him/her and the minimalist, circuit schematic-style aesthetic that the game offers.

(Tip: Unless you're stuck in the distant past, this game is not graphically intense at all {it's in 2D}. You are recommended to launch this game at your monitor's native resolution at the highest possible graphical setting.)

P.S. While "Circuits Composer," the track maker accompanying the game, is there for me to review, I have barely used the software to write a meaningful review.

15890978.review:
Circuits es un juego musical, supuestamente de puzzles aunque realmente yo no lo catalogaría como tal, al ser una experiencia liviana y un poco zen.

El objetivo es escuchar una melodía, e intentar reproducirla con los samples adecuados en el orden correcto, y en algunos casos configurar el número de bucles de algún sample.

Casi todos los niveles son bastante fáciles y muchos de los samples se diferencian bien, además de que se pueden escuchar los canales por separado para que resule más sencillo. En los puzzles más avanzados, no es tan fácil y puede costar un poco, pero se dispone de comodines para facilitar la tarea.

A mí me ha gustado la música (mi mejor manera de describirlo es electrónica ambiental, con un poco de Dubstep y Autotune), aunque las melodías se quedan cortas.

Mención especial a los dos últimos niveles, donde la ayuda de selección de pistas no está disponible, y realmente hace falta concentración y buen oido (o unos cuantos intentos, como fue mi caso) para resolverlos. La verdad, pese a mi poco oído musical, hubiese preferido tener más puzzles de este tipo a lo largo del juego, en lugar de los otros que son muy fáciles de resolver.

El ritmo de introducción de nuevas mecánicas es bueno, pero el total de niveles / melodías se queda un poco corto (25), por lo que no llevar mucho más de 2 horas completarlo.

En cualquier caso, que quede claro que en un juego como este la música lo es todo, y ha de gustarte para que resulte interesante. En mi caso fue así.

En resumen, una experiencia musical interesante y relajante, que puede servir incluso como introducción al uso de secuenciadores y programas similares, y que debido a su corta duración te deja con ganas de más.

15807268.review:
This game seems almost expressly made for me, and I really wanted to love it. However, the problem is that it's almost pushing things too far to even call it a "game". Most of it is an utterly boring exercise in a kind of audio forensic lineup: You listen to a sound and then listen to a whole group of sounds and pick the right one. It's not difficult at all, just tedious, and made much more tedious by the interface, which is designed to get in your way as much as possible in order to provide some kind of challenge. Levels 24 and 25 are the only places where it really becomes interesting, and in theory you could play the whole game using the changes that come about there, but there's no indication that that's what's intended earlier on. Even so, the levels are marred by a great deal of the music and audio coming from automated sequences that aren't triggered by player input at all. It would increase the enjoyment of the game immensely to build *all* parts of the song. Additionally, some segments are mixed so quietly that you're really just guessing. Lastly, and this is going to be a personal preference, but I found a great deal of the music in this game extremely trite and unappealing, which gets tiresome since listening to it over and over is a big part of the gameplay. After a few times through I actually stopped listening to the final compositions entirely, instead just using the fast-forward option to find out if I'd gotten it right or not.

With some more challenging and interesting gameplay, removing layers, removing switches (which were functionally the same as selecting between a group of nodes, just a thousand times more tedious), more complex compositions, making all the components come from the player's nodes with no automated background elements at all, this could be a slightly neat game. As it is, give it a miss.

音当てクイズゲーム。プレイ画面を見ると情報プログラム系の複雑なパズルゲームを予感させるが、このゲームの「回路」は音素を発生させるタイミングを時系列に並べただけのもので頭をひねる要素は全くない。例えば「ドレミ」「ソミレ」「レ」の三つのパーツを使って「チューリップ」のメロディを作りましょうといった感じのゲーム。お手本とパーツを聞き比べて同じ物に交換していく作業が続くだけなのでゲームとしてどうかと訊かれればキッパリ「つまらない」と答えるしかない。音程の違いを聞き分ける作業なら音感トレーニングにも使えそうだが、パーカッションの細かな違い「ドンドンドドン」と「ドンドンﾄﾞﾄﾞドン」みたいなものまで正確に配置しないと何度でもやり直しを命じられる。こんなことなら刺身の上にタンポポを置く仕事をしていた方が楽しいと感じるのは私だけではないはずだ。

正解でも不正解でもとりあえず同じファンファーレが鳴る仕様もゲームの常識から外れており、プレイのたびにストレスが溜まる。音楽の雰囲気は良くパーツを自由に使ってオリジナル曲を作るエディタも付属するのは、このジャンルが好きな人には嬉しいサービスかもしれない。全25面で500円。クリエイターの目指したものは十分に表現できていると感じるので作品評価は「おすすめ」にしておくが、普通のゲームを求めているユーザーにはオススメしません。WindowsよりもMac派な人には合いそうな気がする……のも私だけではないかもしれない。

All in all, this was a fun game, but there's only 25 levels, so it is SHORT. The learning curve is messed up, too. The first few levels are INSANELY easy, the middle ones are just right and the last 2 take away one of the main mechanics so it's incredibly hard. You are trying to identify parts of a musical composition and place them in the correct sequence, paying attention to pitch, chords progression and repetition, all by ear. I'm a musician so this came easy to me (except for the last two levels, which the parts you had to discern were buried under, like, five other parts and you couldn't hear it at all). However, if you're tone deaf, stay away from Circuits.

Pros:
+FANTASTIC MUSIC
+Good interface
+Unique concept

Cons:
-VERY short
-Level difficulty varies inconsistently
-Not for non-music lovers

Overall: 8/10

15334838.review:
Overall: 3.5/10. Would not recommend.

tl;dr: poor navigation, no "quick check" button, poorly written music, system that results more in "guess and check" instead of musical analysis.

When I first heard about a music-puzzle game, I was very eager to try it out. I have been playing music for over 14 years on several instruments and I also have several years of experience composing. The idea of a version of The Talos Principle or Portal geared towards the musically keen was almost too good to be true. 

However, this game is much less about music; it plays like a "find the 10 differences" puzzle. 

When you get into the game, you have two basic tools to solve the puzzle. You have the main circuit with blank sockets, upon which you try to "assemble" the piece of music. You also have the master track at the bottom of your screen, upon which the music sockets rest. You can also kind of organize the pieces around the circuit if you would like to group them up before putting them into the puzzle (and you can't even use the entire screen for it).

Ideally, you listen to the master track. You then click on a piece and know where it should go on the board. Once you have all of the pieces, you listen back to compare and then you know if there is any error or not. 

What actually happens is that the segments of the songs are either a few notes that barely differ or just some strange arbitrary noises. This means that you cannot really analyze it from a musical standpoint and get away with it. Since the differences between the false sockets and the real sockets are so minute, you find yourself trying to jump to the master track and listening to that portion and then directly comparing it while it's still in your ear.

Speaking of which, navigating the master track is awful. You can kind of correspond with it on a the circuit, but you can't bookmark it and you can't isolate a certain section to concentrate on it.

When you go to check the puzzle, you can play it or you can hold the mouse button to "accelerate". This becomes really tedious when you're trying to check for a single error, because you are wasting 15-20 seconds for no reason. There is nothing wrong with a "check song" button.

The music in the game is really bad. It sounds like a lumped mix of ideas that have almost no order and maybe 2 seconds of thought to them. It's like the Zedd/Skrillex notepad of random ideas that they came up with during lunch and then never thought about again.

There is also a very minute mechanic of "repeating" a piece, which is quite illogical. In music, phrases/ideas can consist of 4 notes, 2 measures, 4 measures, 8 measures, etc. Sometimes, the same idea is 4x2 measures (4 repeats of the same 2 measures). Early in the game, sometimes that idea is isolated in one segment, and the others might express it as 4 (that you have to repeat twice) or as 2 (which you have to repeat four times). This is not skillful; it is tedious.

Also, by the time I've finished "writing" the song, I'm sick of hearing it and don't even remember what the entire thing was supposed to sound like. In fact, it's possible to beat the game without listening to a single one of the songs in its entirety. 

The idea is good, but this game is simply not there yet.

15270492.review:
Egy iszonyat egyszerű indie címről van szó. Minden egyes pályaán van egy zeneszám, és azt kell rekonstruállni. Megvan adva x számú "dalrész" és azt kell a helyére pakolnunk. Gyakorlatilag ez a játék lényege. És akkor még ez van megtarkitva azzal hogy különböző "fóliák" vannak, amik között váltogathatunk, hogy egyszerűbb legyen a dolgunk (ilyenkor csak bizonyos hangokra kell figyelnünk, nem a teljes számra). De még bejön a képbe idővel az is, hogy az egyes zenerészletet hányszor kell ismételni, vagy a szakaszt. Illetve van amikkor ki kell választanunk hogy melyik a jó részlet a 3-4 variáció közül. A zeneszámot pedig tetszés szerint játszhatjuk vissza.

Összeségében szerintem egy baromi jó és szorakoztató játék. Szerintem 3-4 óra alatt simán végig lehet játszani. Viszont fejhalgató kötelező hozzá, annélkül játszhatatlan. Illetve neki lehet menni a Golden Ear achievementnek is, ahol mind a 25 pályát (kivétel a 3-ast), úgy kel végig játszani hogy nem válthatunk a "fóliák" között. Aki szeret zenét halgatni annak kötelező, remek kis indie játék.
Előbb útobb kapunk hozzá majd egy Creatort, és akkor bármilyen zenét bele lehet majd rakni, és várhatóan kiscsillió pálya lesz majd fent Steam-en hozzá. Úgy hogy megelőlegezem a 10/10-et neki.

15264175.review:
这个游戏可以称为音乐拼图，通过差异的不同音轨来合成一段旋律确实有创意
游戏中可以直接听复合音轨也可以听单一音轨，两种方法来玩，难度差距完全是两个游戏
选择单一音轨这游戏就0难度，所以我还是坚持全程不听单一音轨进行验证，不然游戏就没啥意思了

如果选择复合音轨，就有一个小问题在于很多时候贝斯确实是很难听出来的
必须通过高音部分来来猜测低音部分所配合的和弦，虽然认真听了但是还是非常不意外的错了几个地方

我非常反感一些鬼畜的节拍游戏，跟着图形打拍子其实已经脱离了纯音乐游戏的本质，简直是带着脚镣跳舞，有那个时间我倒不如直接去弹琴来的痛快
这个游戏就很好，根据音乐片段进行拼图合成，不讲究反应，考验人敏锐的听力和记忆力

在我近年玩过的所有音乐游戏里，这个游戏排第二
第一目前仍然属于龙背上的骑兵3的D路线的最终boss战群婊合唱，从第一次看着屏幕还手忙脚乱，到最后全程闭眼顺利通关，这才是真正意义上的“音游”啊

15033629.review:
まずお手本となる音楽を聞き、その音楽がぶつ切りにされたピースを、お手本通りになるよう配置していくパズル。
ステージは全25ステージだが、ピースの配置がランダムなので、リプレイの際にはピースの音をしっかり聞く必要がある。

～良かった点～
・斬新。「見る」「考える」といったパズルゲームは多くあるが、「聞く」ことが重要視されるパズルは始めてだった。
・言うほど音感は必要なかった。音程が上がっているのか下がっているのか、楽器と曲調が揃ってるかがわかれば良い程度。
・親切。ヒント機能や階層(何の階層かは聞かれてもわからない)を切り替える機能がある。
・適切な難易度設定。段階を追って曲は複雑になり、同じ音を何回鳴らすとか、グループを何回リピートさせるといった要素も加わってくる。

～悪かった点～
・このゲームのみに集中しなければならない。他の音楽を聞きながらや、動画を見ながらのプレイは出来ない。シンプル故に逆に面倒。
・耳障りな音が多い。個人差はあるだろうが、ボーカルや電子音で特にそう感じた。
・達成感がない。これも個人差があるが、クリアしたことよりもさっさと終わらせて他のことをしたいと思うことが多かった。

音楽に関しては全くのド素人(リコーダーすらまともに吹けないレベルの)なので「ああ、このステージ(曲)にはボーカルがあるんだ」とか「和風だなぁ」程度しかわからなかったが、それでも全実績を取ることが出来た。
これは簡単なゲーム内容だったからではなく、集中してプレイしたからだった。
ただ疲れたし、このシンプルな内容のゲームに集中しなければならないのは苦痛でもあった。
例えるならば、ソリティアだとかマインスイーパーのみを起動してプレイし続ける感覚だろうか。
そもそも、音楽に関心のない人間が、パズル部分だけを見てプレイしたのが間違いだったと思うが。

「音楽が好きだけど、多くの音ゲーのように反射神経が必要な物は苦手」なんて方にはおすすめできるかもしれない。

15033179.review:
如果用一般的方式评论Circuits这个游戏，那就是，它内容简单，操作单一，画面毫无可圈可点的地方，没有附加内容，没有联机系统，对了，它甚至没有DLC。
然而，如果你认为我是在批评这个游戏的话，那你就错了，这款游戏最可贵的地方就是它不具有任何华丽的包装，而是将自己游戏的本质部分展现给了玩家，游戏要求玩家听一首曲子，然后游戏将这首曲子的主旋律、鼓点、伴奏进行拆解，组成一幅类似于电路图的画面。而玩家所需要做的，就是将这个电路图拼接完成；而在游戏后期，会慢慢加入循环，选择旋律，曲子的复杂程度也会慢慢增加。而体恤到歌曲的重合部分会影响玩家顺利进行游戏，在游戏的第三关就会将歌曲分层。你可以在关卡开始的时候选择一个层，你聆听的就只是这首曲子的拆解部分。然而，这样游戏便毫无难度，你只要有耐心和时间，完全可以听一个拼一个。可能制作者也考虑到了这一点，于是他们在游戏中加入了Golden Ears这个成就，要求玩家除了第三关外都不允许分层游戏。这确实是一个很聪明的做法，全成就的强迫症们和只是消遣的玩家都能收获乐趣。
然而，游戏能带给你的也就这有这些，这不是一个快节奏的游戏，它适合你在闲暇的时候，平稳心绪，仔细去听藏在曲子后面的那些音符。也不要想做一个几小时就通关的全成就打算，心里越急，越焦躁，越是难以辨别。然而，游戏性也终究只能延伸到这里。当你开始对游戏机制感觉到有些不耐烦时，当你开始看着越来越复杂的地图有点难以承受时，你点进了最后一关，你会发现，这个游戏是那么的善意，仅仅只有25关，没有任何的附加内容，游戏的制作者是一家很小的视频公司，他们甚至没有把OST拆开，而是直接附在了游戏的安装文件中，没有任何保留。
游戏本身，也经过了无数次的打折，进包。也许有无数玩家也拿它当做加一，但，如果你喜欢纯音乐，喜欢静下心来享受游戏，我诚挚地推荐你去尝试，去感受音乐的诞生和魅力。

15000857.review:
[h1]Meditation made easy, by sound and sight[/h1]

Given this game is quite simplicistic, even has some zen like qualities. But still it is very captivating, the sound is one example how even a simple listen and repeat game can be quite well programmed.

The use of headphones is strongly encouraged in this game, I would offer the sugestion to wear closed models - because at some tunes even minute disturbance can get you erring (which isn't all bad - because the game is quite forgiving and fair).

Even if you leave the achievements aside, this game is fun to play, it has a relaxing quality that puts some other riddle games to a shame, it's like an intuitive backflip into earlier times of experimental software concepts - and it is doing it very well. 

I personaly gifted this game now to several people, all of them were happy with the game and liked it for the design, the sound and the great replayability... plus the added bonus that now is coming with the game. One reviever already said, that this game is a outstanding puzzle game. I have to agree and to add, that only a few other games of this genre have a similiar magic working their way.

Could I recomend this game? Definetly, if you have some spare money on you, go buy it - you probably won't regret the buy - especially if you are a great fan of puzzle games. When you are a casual player who likes zen like minimalism, go get it. It is one of my favored indie titles.

14916503.review:
[h1]Schönes Spiel mit interessantem Konzept[/h1]
Auf den ersten Blick dachte ich, Circuits hätte etwas mit Schaltkreisen und Puzzles dazu zutun. Das liegt vermutlich am Namen und dem Design.
In Wirklichkeit ist Circuits ein Spiel, indem man in 25 Leveln Schnipsel einer Melodie entlang einer Zeitachse so anordnen muss, dass die Melodie der vorgegebenen entspricht.
Der Soundtrack gefällt mir sehr und ist wohl auch im Spielverzeichnis enthalten zum so hören.
Leider sind im Moment wie gesagt nur 25 Level verfügbar, sodass man relativ schnell mit dem Spiel durch ist, dazu kommt noch, dass die einzelnen Melodien auch nicht sehr lang sind, jeweils so ca. 30-60 Sekunden denke ich, beim derzeitigen Preis aber akzeptabel.
Der Entwickler hat auch bereits versprochen, da nachzubessern und weitere Level hinzuzufügen, zudem kommt demnächst kostenfrei für alle, die das Spiel besitzen ein "Composer", mit dem man eigene Melodien erstellen und mit anderen teilen kann, allerdings noch keine eigenen Level.

14914661.review:
Das Spiel ist toll! Ich empfehle hier ein gutes Headset / gute Kopfhörer!
Das Spielprinzip wird gut erklärt in dem Video. Im Grunde sind es kleine Musikteile, die man zusammenpuzzlen muss. 
Als Tipp empfehle ich bei zuvielen verschiedenen Kreisen sie einfach im Bild zu sortieren s(ie bleiben da haften, wo man sie hinschiebt). Dann fällt es leichter die richtigen Teile zu finden.

Für alle Achievementjäger sei gesagt, dass ihr auf jegliche Hilfen in Bezug auf Tonspuren (oben links) oder Hints (unten rechts) verzichten müsst, außer bei dem Level wo es erklärt wird. Dann erhaltet ihr am Ende 100%. Zudem müsst ihr ein paar Level auf anhieb (sprich im ersten Durchlauf) schaffen. 

Sehr lange dauert das Spiel nicht (hab es durch inkl. AVs) aber für das Geld ist es wirklich gelungen!
Ich habe jedenfalls etwas über zusammenspiel einzelner Komponenten der Musik etwas gelernt und das man in den meisten Fällen raushört, wenn man sich vertan hat! 

Ich würde mir einen Nachfolger wünschen!

14902761.review:
음악을 듣고 맞는 음절을 조립해나가는 절대음감 게임.

퍼즐 게임으로써의 단순하고 깔끔한 그래픽도 잘 갖추었고, 인터페이스도 대단히 깔끔하다. 

주어진 음악을 다시 완성해나간다는 게임의 컨셉이 대단히 참신하다. 이거 때문에 게임이 퍼즐 게임이 아니라 그냥 음악 게임이 되어버렸다는게 문제라면 문제겠지만. 헤드셋이 있다면 무조건 헤드셋을 사용하기를 추천한다. 아무래도 헤드셋이 아니라면 음을 제대로 잡아내기도 어렵고, 그만큼 게임도 어려워진다. 가급적이면 좋은 헤드셋을 쓰기를 권장한다. 후반으로 갈 수록 음이 잘 안들리고, 맨 마지막 25스테이지에는 아예 안들리는 음이 있을 정도.

각 음역대에 맞는 음을 조립하는 재미가 있다. 게임에서 주어진 것들도 생각보다 다양한 편이고. 그리고 극후반 24, 25스테이지를 제외하면 각 음역대의 음을 따로따로 들을 수 있어 게임을 더 편하게 할 수 있다. 물론 이 짓을 하지 않고 게임을 클리어하는 것도 가능하다. 이 쪽이 좀 더 재밌기도 하고. (무엇보다 도전과제가 하나 걸려있어서...) 스테이지가 고작 25개밖에 안되서 불만이긴 하지만, 애초에 엄청 싼 가격의 게임이니 이 정도면 나쁘지 않다.

어쨌거나 인디 게임으로써의 참신함을 잘 살린 괜찮은 게임.

Nice little music game. Have to agree with the person who wrote that this may be quite a bit more challenging for those without a musical background. Steam has me logged at under 4 hrs. Finished it in that time and that included taking the dogs out for walks, making and eating dinner and such. I found it quite easy, but enjoyed my time with it.

The developer seems to be promising some more stuff with the software, and I think it's great that they are working on a composition tool. The interface would be a great relaxing way to throw together some music. Would also love to see some longer compositions for the game portion.

At the price point (I picked up on sale for about a dollar) I'd say it's certainly worth the cash. Enjoyable but simple (again, simple coming from a musical background. If you're tone deaf, it might be a bit more of a challenge).

14848089.review:
Circuits is a wonderful puzzle game to challenge your musical hearing abilities...

[b] ...if you don't already have over a decade of musical experience. [/b]

99% of you are probably don't have the best ears in the world when it comes to music, so for most of you out there, I will definitely recommend this. But be prepared for some pretty difficult puzzles!

However, for those with a history of extensive musical training, don't expect to use much thought process. I myself am a music composition major in university, and have been playing music since the age of 2. Needless to say, I was able to complete all the puzzles with total ease, without using any hints or switching to individual instrument layers. If you think you would be in a similar position as me, either wait until more difficult puzzles are introduced into the game (the devs are considering adding some more challenging levels), or simply get the game now, and use it as a method to relax.
On a side note, I hear there is a new extention or software coming soon called Circuits Composer, which means that the community might be able to provide us with some truly challenging puzzles, possibly even for music graduates.

My final word is that I fully recommend this game to people who don't have impossibly sharp ears, as you'll be developing your hearing abilities through levels that you may find yourself stuck on for hours. And even for the others, I would still recommend the game, given that you keep in mind my comments above.

I'll be looking forward to any future updates!

14833288.review:
I picked up Circuits because of the cheap price and the somewhat intriguing game concept. While most music games are based primarily around rhythmic timing, Circuits is more based on pitch and tone recognition. This makes for a pretty unique experience. Given that it's a music-based game, having a solid soundtrack is important - thankfully, Circuits delivers on that front with a well-made relaxing atmospheric soundtrack. My biggest critique is the relatively short length.

If you consider yourself completely tone-deaf, I'd have a hard time recommending this. But if you're looking for a relaxing, musical way to pass by a couple hours, then it's hard to come up with a better recommendation than Circuits.

14787937.review:
This is a great game that is all about paying attention to sounds. It is exactly what the storefront suggests it is - a minimalistic music puzzle game. It doesn't try and be something it is not.

Listen to a track and attempt to assemble it from a select set of sound clips. Didn't hear something correctly or can't make it out with everything else playing at the same time? Isolate the track and make the repairs as needed. Can't find the part that is wrong? Use some tips to mark the erroneous sound clips. Just keep in mind if you use these you won't get the star achievement for this game - completing the game without separating tracks, using tips, or making any errors.

14697249.review:
30秒程度の音楽を流し、その音楽が再現されるように切り分けられた音を回路に配置したり、音のループ回数を設定したりするゲーム。
パズルというよりはリズムの関わらない音ゲーといった感じ。シーク、音のレイヤー切り替え、ヒントなどを利用して進めていく。
音楽は壮大なものからアンビエントっぽいもの、ボーカルの入ったものまで様々ある。
3月1日現在まだ実装されていないが、ユーザーで問題を製作し、Steam Workshopを通じてやりとりできるようにもなるようだ。
ある程度音感がないと難しく感じるであろう点から少々人を選ぶゲームかもしれないが、音楽は良く、ゲーム内容もシンプルで、それなりに楽しめる。
300円くらいなら買ってもいいかな、と思えるだけの興味と多少の音感があればやってみても良いと思う。

14683413.review:
Este juego lo conseguí en un Humble y no le presté mucha atención. Al cabo del tiempo lo probé y contemplé un título original cuyo concepto resulta muy interesante.

Consiste en melodías que se dividen en instrumentos los cuales puedes escuchar repetidas veces juntos o por separado. Estas divisiones se presentan en forma de piezas que tienes que ir colocando a lo largo de la canción de manera que concuerde con la canción original. Aunque esta explicación parezca compleja, mira cualquier vídeo, es bastante simple.

Siempre voto positivo cualquier intento o éxito de innovación y cualquier vía de escape a los shooters y survivals que nos invaden hoy en día. Aunque hay algunas canciones que son bastante "feas" y no tienen ritmo ni con cola, hay otras que tienen bastante encanto y me gusta escucharlas repetidas veces.

Recomendable, pero tengo que decir que aunque el precio de Steam parezca barato, no creo que merezca la pena gastárselo en este juego.

14643775.review: As an admirer of good electronica I bought this, only to discover whether or not you place the samples in the correct order or not you still end up with a soundtrack that reminds one of some execrable 'Daft Punk' effort, oh dear.

14636239.review:
画面非常简洁，元素一目了然。
其实不用文字，单靠画面玩家就能了解游戏的玩法。
把乐曲编排以类似电路图的形式表现，把乐谱上成行的音符转变成直观的树状结构，想必不仅对于玩家，对于其他作曲家也是眼前一亮吧。

游戏的难度不是一般的高。优点与缺点都体现在挑战性上。
如果没有进行过专门的乐理学习，仅凭平时打游戏时听音乐培养起的乐感，想要达成“Golden Ears”成就，简直是对玩家的乐感无尽的考验。

如此难度，每过一关所获得的成就感不亚于通关一个单独的游戏。
在任何一关都可以选择跳过本关，在众多高难独立游戏之中，这点难能可贵。

[spoiler] 如果不在乎全成就，以层间切换+两种提示，仔细辩听，还是可以很快确定各个圆圈的顺序的。[/spoiler]

14611484.review:
一个音乐拼图游戏，简称拼音（？）游戏。
每个关卡会给出一首完整的乐曲和组成这个乐曲的小片段，只要把这些片段按顺序重新拼合成完整的乐曲就算完成关卡。
听上去很简单是不是୧(๑•̀ᴗ•́๑)୨
其实对于没有音乐基础的木耳来说真的[b]超难[/b]啊啊啊！！！( ´•̥̥̥ω•̥̥̥` )
为什么我听同类型小片段常常感觉它们根本都是一样的呢可恶！！(╯°□°）╯︵ ┻━┻

不过游戏还是很玩家友好型的，有贴心方便的快进功能，小片段也帮忙按类型分好了，可以单独提出来试听，还有提示和纠错机会。
游戏画面非常简洁有科技感，当每每填完空，看着最后试音时进度条随着美妙的音乐流过一个个代表乐曲小片段的光圈最后到达接地符号判定是否成功时，内心真犹如等待老师报出分数般激jian动ao呢,,Ծ‸Ծ,,﻿
喜欢音乐[strike]或者想挑战一下自己有多耳残[/strike]可以入一个试试哦。

14575724.review:
Mouais, mouais, mouais... Bien qu'ayant d'indéniables bons côtés, je n'ai pas aimé Circuits.

[h1]But du jeu[/h1]

25 "circuits" jouent une mini-mélodie, séparée au max. en 3 couches de sons différents superposés ; chaque couche est découpée en morceaux. Ce sont ces morceaux qu'il faut remettre dans le bon ordre.

[h1]Points forts (objectifs)[/h1]

[list]
[*]Bonne qualité de l'ensemble du soft : graphismes et sons clean ;
[*]Juste prix : 3€, pour 25 niveaux (dont la première quinzaines se réussit en 15 minutes max.) ;
[*]Jeu finissable à 100%.
[/list]

[h1]Points négatifs (objectifs)[/h1]

[list]
[*]Il faut un casque audio : certains morceaux audio sont quasi-inaudibles... Enfin, je suppose que pour les mélomanes, c'est du gâteau ; mais pour un non-initié, des fois, c'est du placement aléatoire ;
[*]Il faut aimer l'électro. Pas de rock, pas de rap, pas de chansons d'un genre ou d'un autre, niet. Electro, dubstep, etc. uniquement ;
[*]Les morceaux ne durent que 30 sec. max. Même pour ceux qui aiment l'électro, ça doit être frustrant.
[/list]

[h1]Point négatif (subjectif)[/h1]

Même si l'emballage est beau, ce n'est qu'un jeu du même accabit que mettre une certaine forme dans le trou qui va bien (oui, celui auquel on a tous joué à 2 ans) : ici, on met un certain son dans le trou qui va bien.

Je n'aime pas assez l'électro pour recommencer, avec le sourire, un niveau 5 fois juste parce que le morceau n°3 a son 5e beat 1/4 de secondes plus tôt que le morceau n°6.

[h1]Note[/h1]

Un compositeur devrait sortir en 2015. Peut-être donnera-t-il un intérêt supplémentaire au titre...

Got this recently in a bundle and had no clue as to what this game was about. At first i though it was something involving electrical circuits, but its not :P The game is about placing musical samples along a timeline matching them up to the default audio track/snippet for that level (or from the ost which is included) Its sounds simple and at first it is, until you get to around the 12th level then it starts to get challenging (for me). 

I have not completed this game, but i eventually will do as i found it a very relaxing game to play, with a simple to use interface nothing complex at all, and its currently in a bundle somewhere i think i paid $1 for the whole bundle and it was worth it just for this game alone.

Did i mention the OST came with the game :)

14137905.review:
Un Puzzle game musicale indépendant qui à une durée de vie assez courte (3-5 heures)
Mais qui vous offrira un moment unique.

Le jeu est graphiquement épuré avec des petites touches colorées qui correspondent très bien à l'ambiance musicale apaisante. plus axé sur de l'électro calme, les OST sont fournis avec le jeu et sont très agréable à réécouter.

Le gameplay est très simple, on écoute la musque pour ensuite la recrée à l'aide de "cercle musicaux" à placé dans l'ordre sur un schéma.
Une fois en place on valide la piste. Des mécaniques s'ajoutent au travers les 25 niveaux ce qui ne le rend pas répétitif
La difficulté augmente sans trop être élevée.

Très bon jeu, un éditeur de son par module à été ajouter, qui est assez sympas et facile d'utilisation.


Si vous avez cinq euros pour vous évader un petit moment, je ne peux que vous le conseiller. succées et carte Steam en bonnus

13958616.review:
Circuits est un petit jeu de puzzle audio ou il faut placer les bouts de piste aux bons emplacements prédéterminé.
Les mécaniques sont simples, intuitive et efficace.
Les niveaux se renouvellent tous les 3-4 niveaux, en rajoutant des petits éléments de game play. Ce qui permet de ne pas se lasser, mais aussi de permettre aux pistes de devenir plus complexe.
L’ambiance du jeu est calme et minimaliste, ni plus ni moins que ce qu’il faut.
Circuits est composé de 25 niveaux pour environ 4 heures de jeu, sans se presser.

Un petit jeu pas très long, pas très cher, bien fait au niveau visuel et sonore.

Circuits is indeed an outstanding game aiming all ages. I first heard of this from friends on the timeline while I was not sure if such type of game could be so popular among the large base of users on the Steam. But I've changed my idea since it gets really high score from multiple players. I love playing music-related games.

From what I've been with this, this game brings you the almost perfect experience of the ears and mind. Although the music of each level is a bit short, you still can be a creative person while listening to the loops and then try to imagine what's gonna be played through the headphone. Somehow you will find yourself immersing in the music around, unlike other people saying, I think people don't need to be a bachelor of music degree(funny, right?), don't even need to master the basic theory, just stay tuned and listen to all loops intently, every small distinction you find will excite yourself as a reward.

Combining kaleidoscopic spots with electronic loops that not only touches but also impresses players, this game has become the most exhilarating one I've had in my list. I just wanna say that if the producer releases the full soundtrack, I will definitely go for it.

Enjoy it! You won't regret.

Edited: The new composer is just a mini music producer, I enjoy it pretty much!

13536120.review:
Circuits is a casual music sequence puzzler. You are tasked with putting together the provided music samples in the correct order to duplicate the target sequence. Some samples may repeat. Some sequences of samples may repeat. You must listen well in order to dicern the difference between some samples. To ease you into the more complicated sequences, you can isolate "layers" which correspond to a voice or instrument. Be the end, you must rely on your ears and wits alone.

This game is not about contructing popular or recognizable music. It is, however, a thematic study of an original piece. If you do not have much patience or well-tuned ears, you may find this game frustrating. However, if you enjoy music and want to improve your listening skills, I believe you will enjoy this game.

13515042.review:
If you are the one audience member clapping out of sync with everyone else, then this game is not for you. That doesn't mean, however, that this is Dance Dance Revolution episode 99. This is quite a different and innovative little game.

The gameplay is about first listening to a track as it should sound, and then reconstructing it using sound bites that you place on the "circuit" in order to finish and play the track.

As in any other puzzle game you have to use your brain, but your "input" for solving it isn't so much visual elements on a board, but instead sounds, recognition of small variations, and utilizing your short term memory from when you listen to the track (you can do that at any time) to finding the right sound bite/puzzle piece. This gameplay mechanic is quite innovative!

[b]-- Should you buy it? --[/b]
If you find the concept, and perhaps the trailer, even moderately intriguing, then yes. I think you will be positively surprised.
If you are interested in music, but not usually puzzle games, then still yes.
Casual gamers, and people who don't usually play puzzle games, might get a bit frustrated at times, but it is cheap, so take the opportunity to try something different.

A possible caveat is that your skill in solving the puzzles is quite independent from previous (puzzle) game experience, since it depends on your ability to "hear" and understand the music, and you can't really know until you try it. But you probably have a pretty good idea about whether you are "musical" or not.

- Time to finish all 25 levels (currently) is about 3 hours, and perhaps an additional hour if you want to complete the most challenging achievement.
- If you want all achievements, then I recommend reading the requirement for "Golden Ear" and solve it as you pass through the levels (or make a note of which levels you haven't solved in this way).
- The game includes the soundtrack, which probably isn't something you'd listen to on repeat, but it is pretty cool.

13374188.review:
한마디로 요약하면 절대음감 게임

주어진 음악를 듣고서 레이어별로 어떤 멜로디/박자가 흐르는지 이해해야 된다.
그런 다음 맞는 노드에 맞는 음을 넣어서 주어진 음악를 완성시키는게 이 게임의 목적.
음감이 부족한 사람들을 위하여 극후반 24,25레벨과 극초반 튜토리얼 단계를 제외하고는 음을 레이어 단위로 쪼갤 수 있다.
하지만 24,25레벨은 이 기능이 사라져서 난이도가 급격히 상승한다.
플레이타임 중 거의 한시간 이상을 저 두 레벨에 소모했을 정도.

음악의 장르는 거의 전자 음악 위주로 되어있다.
오토튠을 사용하는 음악도 몇개 있었다.
어쿠스틱한 느낌을 기대하고 플레이하면 절대 안된다.

딱 값어치만큼의 볼륨을 뽑아주는 게임이다 (3달러 = 3시간)
사소한 단점이 있다면 헤드셋이 아닌 이어폰이나 스피커를 사용하면 음의 느낌이 확실히 죽는 다는 것.
그리고 노드간 볼륨 차이가 커서 가끔씩 큰 소리 때문에 놀란다는 것.
마지막으로 Golden Ear라는 미친 도전과제가 있다는 것.

13240744.review:
Si vous aimez la musique (plutôt orientée électro-dubstep et epic music), que vous aimez les puzzle-games, et que vous voulez passer un moment sympa pour vous détendre, alors Circuits est fait pour vous !

Le principe est simple, écouter la musique dans son ensemble, puis recomposer la même musique (avec ou sans l'aide des layers !) grâce aux "pastilles" correspondant à une petite phrase musicale.

Détendant à souhaits ! On regrettera le peu de niveau (25 seulement) et les deux derniers niveaux franchement hardcore (pas de possibilités d'isoler les pistes). Mais avec l'arrivée du Circuits Composer, ça sera sans doute un vrai régal de composer pour les autres joueurs ! En tout cas, j'attends ça avec impatience !

[h1]Изумительная музыкальная головоломка.[/h1]

Перед вами предстают 25 уровней, на каждом из которых представлена звуковая дорожка, составленная из "пазлов". После того, как вы её прослушали, попробуйте собрать её по частям с нуля. Задача далеко не самая простая. Да, для начала вам даются довольно простые треки, но чем дальше, тем сложнее и ухватить все звуки становится не так просто. Треки здесь, к слову, классные, представлены смесью дабстепа и эпических оркестровок.

13155667.review:
PLEASE NOTE:  this game has nothing to do with electronics, wiring, or circuitry-- it's a music game!  Who knew?

Actually, it's a *fantastic* little indie music game great for any musician, person with musical talent, or even anybody who just wants to improve his/her musical ear.  The "circuits" are just the visual manifestation of how the music plays out-- pay no heed-- it will make sense once you try the game.

Basically, you listen to some synth music, and with your ear (assisted by optional in-game hints), figure out which chords go where in the progression; which sections are looped (and how much), what the beat patterns are (and how they are repeated).  I don't consider myself a huge fan of techno/synth/trance (some of it I like), but I found all of the music pleasant to listen to.

There are 25 levels-- whether it's a long game or a short game is completely based on how you are able to figure out the levels.  For achievement-hunters, if you have a great ear (or don't mind using some in-game or Steam Guide hints), you can 100% it with relative ease...there's nothing unreasonable.

I bought it "on sale" for $1.19, but it's only $3...less than a coffee-- and it has trading cards you can sell or use.  Give it a try and support these indie devs.  I'm just hoping for a Circuits 2!

[Edit:  One more thing:  if you like the music, the soundtrack is available as MP3s in your game folder, which is something like C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Circuits\OST.]

13154087.review:
Circuits, the rhythm-based indie game by Digital Tentacle, is much like any other rhythm/timing game: it has amazing music. That being said, this game separates itself in a way even I found myself intrigued by. The game was much less timing as it was having that pitch-perfect listening to hear the music, which changed from orchestra to upbeat electronica. Instead of fast reflexes, it was more fine tuning what you hear overall. Sadly, it is too good to last and leaves you wanting more. Breakdown:

Pros:
+ Amazing music score, what more can be said?
+ Interesting game mechanics (Not speed, but smarts).
+ Simplistic control scheme, nothing to be confused about.

Cons:
- Somewhat predictable melody.
- Difficulty curve turns into a wall right at the end (not very in-tune [hurr] with the game pacing).
- Too good to last forever (not really a con, but its like having a really good cake).

13060027.review:
Circuits es un juego indie hasta cierto punto experimental, desarrollado en España, en el que nuestra labor es escuchar atentamente para poner los sonidos disponibles en los huecos adecuados, y así componer la melodía completa para superar el nivel. 

El título es bastante corto (en 3-4 horas se puede terminar perfectamente) y salvo los dos últimos niveles no presenta un reto excesivamente difícil, incluso para los que somos algo duros de oído. Un juego que si se degusta poco a poco, en pequeños bocados, superando unos pocos niveles cada día, acaba dejando muy buenas sensaciones, pues obliga a tomárselo con calma y termina por relajar bastante.

Por los apenas 3€ que cuesta, 100% recomendado. Además, el proyecto sigue "vivo", pues sus desarrolladores ya han comentado en la comunidad que están ultimando una expansión que introducirá nuevos niveles y un editor (con soporte para Steam Workshop), que será gratuito para todos los poseedores del juego.

In this game, it's helpful to have some musical background, because you will need a sensitive ear to arrange missing bits of music to form the complete songtrack of the puzzle. The difficulty scales relatively smoothly, and the music is great too.

Do help yourself and buy this game if you seek a fusion between music and puzzlers, you will not be disappointed!

When the author calls it a "musical puzzle game," he's speaking quite literally--think of this game as a jigsaw puzzle except the pieces are made of soundbytes instead of cardboard.

Like the visual style of jigsaw puzzle, you aren't just playing for the challenge, but as a unique means of experiencing art. In the same way that a visual jigasaw forces you to study the work closely to identify where pieces belong, the music must be listened to closely to identify where the samples go, and how many times they loop.

And the music is amazing, and worth the price of admittance on its own. 

10/10, would buy again at full price.

12714173.review:
Mam mieszane uczucia co do tej gry. Pomysł na rozgrywkę jest oryginalny - puzzle dźwiękowe. Próbujemy odtworzyć prezentowaną melodię z dostępnych sampli ustawiając je w ścieżkę, robiąc powtórki i rozgałęzienia. Sample są podzielone na 3 grupy, zawierające podobne dźwięki. Niestety są one czasem "zbyt podobne" i nie mając słuchu doskonałego ciężko czasem jest je dopasować. Jakość tych sampli jest zróżnicowana, niektóre są bardzo przyjemne dla ucha inne przyprawiają o zgrzytanie zębów. Przekłada się to też na "rozwiązywaną melodię", miejscami bardzo solidną, a miejscami przypominającą kakofonię różnych przypadkowych dźwięków. 

Na szczęście twórcy gry wprowadzili dla ludków którym słoń nadepnął na ucho, czyli takich jak ja, możliwość rozwiązywania każdej grupy sampli osobno. A także przyciski pomocy (ograniczone ilościowo) ustawiające pojedyncze sample we właściwych miejscach, oraz sprawdzające poprawność umieszczenia (wskazuje błędy). Niestety ostatnie dwa poziomy są pozbawione możliwości osobnego rozwiązywania grup sampli. W moim przypadku skończyło się to na niemożliwości rozwiązania ich na słuch. Zmusiło mnie do ustawiania sampli w z grubsza właściwych miejscach i używania sprawdzania poprawności, tak aby rozwiązać poziom jak w "mastermaind" - co chyba nie jest ideą tej gry. W tym miejscu twórcy trochę przedobrzyli z trudnością.

Grę można ukończyć w 2-3 godziny, a być może nawet szybciej. Nie jest to zbyt dużo, szczególnie że charakter puzzli nie zachęca do powtórzenia rozgrywki. Być może, zapowiadana przez autorów, możliwość tworzenia własnych poziomów i dzielenia się nimi z innymi zmieni ten stan rzeczy. 

Zdecydowanie nie jest to gra dla każdego. Może się spodobać melomanom, właścicielom słuch absolutnego czy też miłośnikom nietuzinkowych gier. Inni powinni się mocno zastanowić przed zakupem gdyż mogą się rozczarować charakterem rozrywki. W każdym razie nie polecam kupować tej gry w pełnej cenie, tylko poczekać do jakiejś promocji.


Gdyby się dało wystawił bym tej grze ocenę neutralną - ale niestety nie da się. Nie zasługuje na negatywa, więc ma pozytyw, głównie za pomysł.

12699927.review:
Circuits has nothing to do with electricity, but it does require a good musical ear to distinguish sometimes subtle differences in sound samples. And that's basically what circuits is all about--chaining musical samples together to reproduce the default piece of each level. While the music samples are pretty good, as a game where the player simply tries to reproduce what he hears, I didn't find it all that fun or engaging.

As I played the game, I was thinking that the user should be able to make his own musical scores based on the samples provided. And apparently there is a Circuits Composer feature coming soon which I think will make this game a fun little music generator. So I give it a thumbs up for a future unreleased feature. The base game isn't all that impressive, but it's hard not to recommend it given the sale price.

Dieses Spiel ist eines der spaßigsten Spiele, die ich in letzter Zeit spielen konnte - und meine Bibliothek ist groß.

Ich bin ein Electro-, Dubstep- und Drum&Bass-Fanatiker seit vielen Jahren. In diesem Spiel kann ich in Puzzles Basslines, Vocals und Melodien zusammensetzen. Das macht sicher auch Fans anderer Musikrichtungen viel Spaß, mir jedoch noch umso mehr!

Man braucht kein großes Musikverständnis, um Spaß an diesem Spiel haben zu können. Allerdings einen guten Kopfhörer, mit dem man nicht nur den Bass hören kann (Hipsterkopfhörer vom Grabbeltisch sind hier vermutlich eher schlecht). Auch sollte das Gehör nicht durch exzessiven Konsum von zu lauter Musik oder hohem Alter zerstört worden sein :D

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad zieht nach den ersten paar Levels enorm an - das merkt man. Jedoch zwingt man sich dadurch dazu, besser hinzuhören und schärft damit unterbewusst seinen Hörsinn.

Derzeit ist das Spiel für nen Euro zu haben - also kauf' es dir, anstatt ihn dem Punker an der nächsten Straßenecke zu geben - der hört nämlich schlechtere Musik! ;-)

12576895.review: Interesting, but poorly named and somewhat frustrating. The game has nothing in relation to Circuits of the electronic variety in any way. There are 25 songs that you spend a great deal of time trying to replicate for the very short length of music. In 3 hours, I'd completed the game. Fortunately not very expensive. In most songs you're allowed to switch 'layers' so you're only hearing for example the melodies or the bass, so you can limit what you're hearing and make it easier to replicate. But the last two songs are the most complex pieces of music in the game, and don't allow you to limit the layers like you've been taught the rest of the game. There are parts in both of the last two levels that are so complex with so many instruments at varying loudness that it is impossible to make out the instruments you're actually trying to replicate. I had no choice but to resort to the 'hint' button for them.

12538213.review:
[h1]Introduction:[/h1] Circuits is an independent masterpiece. It is highly original, and I have never seen another game like it! While it's mechanics are deceitfully simple, you will come to find Circuits both stimulating and satisfying. The objective is to string together various segments of a song in the correct order... Easy, right? =)

[h1]Story:[/h1] If you only play games with a primary focus on storytelling, Circuits might not be the game for you. If you can, however, enjoy a game without a tale to tell, I really implore you to try this game.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1] If you are a music lover, this game might suit you. The gameplay revolves around the music, and I assure you that the soundtrack is superb, and with good reason. Basically, all you have to do is listen to the song and figure out how to recreate it on an empty template. You can listen to the song in layers, or as a whole, depending on how well you can pick apart sound. The game doesn't take long to beat, and my only complaint is the difficulty. It starts off extremely easy, and at some point takes a leap into higher difficulties. Overall, this game is extremely enjoyable, especially if you're just looking for something relaxing to do.

[h1]Controls:[/h1] This game offers an untraditional approach to gaming. While the controls are simple enough, and playable simply with a mouse, it is best played with a set of headphones. This helps the player to become immersed in the sounds, which in turn will aid them on their quest to put the sounds in the correct sequence.

[h1]Graphics:[/h1] Sleek, simple, and to the point: Circuit's interface is highly appealing, and not overly cluttered. The music will be threaded together on a maze of lines, taking the form of colourful circles, which will light up as they are played. The background is subtle, and overall, I feel that the graphics are reasonable.

[b]Sound:[/b] The audio is possibly Circuit's best selling feature, in my opinion. While some sounds are not entirely appealing, most are incredibly easy to listen to. It is easy on the ears, and progresses in difficulty throughout the players gaming experience. There isn't a lot left to critique. 

[h1]Replay Value:[/h1] I'd be willing to play Circuits again, I'm kind of a sucker for puzzle games, so I tend to play a puzzle per week, or so.

Музична гра з робочою областю, схожою на електросхему, в якій нам пропонується з кількох елементів, схожих один на одного за звучанням, складати повну композицію на слух, шляхом розміщення їх в певні місця, вказування кількості повторів. 12500402.review:
A very nice indie puzzle game that makes you pay attention to a tune and then replicate it by putting the right circles in the right sockets. It is a very nice concept, although the 25 levels don't take a long time to beat. What would complete this game would be a level editor with Workshop integration. Other than that, I believe its a reasonably fun game that is well priced for the few hours of entertainment that it will give you.

The sound is very high in quality, and the experience using headphones (as recommended by the game itself) is enjoyable.

Also good news for achievement hunters (such as myself). This game only has 15 achievements that are all easily obtainable, with the exception of two that require you to refrain from using helpful elements of gameplay.

12498950.review:
Circuits in it's basic form is a puzzle game, put the correct piece in the correct spot and see if everything looks right. However, what it does differently is every piece of the puzzle is a short piece of music, which you need to put into the correct position to recreate the whole score for the level. You might think this is quite simplistic, but if you are not a very musically driven person like me, it may be somewhat difficult to differ which piece goes where, due to some of them sounding very similar. The game slowly introduces different mechanics like layers, looping and switches, which increases the difficulty if you don't listen carefully.
All in all this simplistic game is a very cheap gem on the steam store that forces you to listen to be able to solve the puzzle instead of staring and observing like many other games but can still be quite challenging and time consuming, although time is not wasted when you finally get to hear the masterpiece you put together.

12488757.review:
I simply can't recommend this game after playing it for the time that I did. If you want it for the music then yea ok this might work for you, but if you are thinking of buying this because it's a "challenging puzzle game" don't waste your money.
     Let me start by saying that the only thing about it that is to do with circuits is the earth symbol at the end of the line. Poor choice of title really, should of gone with something a bit more music orientated. But a poor choice of title is not worth giving a bad review, no.
     The fact that it boasts "challenging puzzle" makes me laugh. The first 23 levels I completed in the time played were simplistic and easy. You listen to a music strand and match it with the one that sounds the same, thats all it is. Count the repeats and set it to that many... not very puzzling (puzzled = "unable to understand"). The only challenge was trying to decipher the 1 decibel (it's an exaggeration before you start screaming at me) between the multiple choice music strands, which I will admit was challenging but again easy to get around.
     Now the music was ok, the mojority of it i liked however there were bits were I felt like my ears were bleeding and the vocals were crap. I really don't think there should of been any vocals at all.
     The last 2 levels I didn't complete because their idea of making something more of a challenge or harder is to take out the main game mechanic. Let me explain, in game you have a sytem to choose which type of strand to listen to so you don't get then all mixed together when trying to decipher which one goes where. This gets taken out the game on the last 2 levels so you have to listen to the 3 different types of strands plus the background music and try and make out which one of all these 20 different music strands that sound very similar is the right one to go in that slot. It's a terrible shortcut to making the game harder without much effort. 
     All in all I really don't think anyone should buy this game, short, easy and borring it's not much fun. Luckily I only paid 69p for it and I don't think it was worth that. Hope this review helps your dicision and have a nice day.

12480382.review:
A unique puzzle game, almost like an audible jigsaw puzzle.  You have various snippets of musical elements, and your task is to reconstruct the full track by inserting the elements in the correct order (and later on, establishing if they loop and how many times they loop, or picking the right subtle variation of a particular element out of maybe four or five options).

It's incredibly challenging, because I don't think I've ever played a game like this.  You REALLY have to listen closely in places, and the final two levels are brutal because you lose your ability to strip out the individual "tracks" of the puzzle.  But it's a fun experience, there's a great feeling when you play your finished solution and you just know from hearing it that you nailed it.

If I had to complain, it's a tad short (3.1 hours to complete it, not going back for 100% achievements) and there's not good feedback when your solution is incorrect: you listen to it all the way through, it gives the same ending sound and animation whether you got it right or not, and only when the little dialog pops up does it say "you screwed up".  Both are forgivable seeing as it's an indie game with a low price point; not saying this to be derogatory, I think it's a fantastic game regardless.

Plus, you get the soundtrack for free with the game, it helps that the puzzle songs have decent variety and are very earwormy (I would love to hear extended versions of the last song and the song that actually has lyrics in it, I forget the title/track number of the second song).  And with Steam Workshop features coming, I think it will be pretty cool to see what kinds of new puzzles the community comes up with.

In closing (i.e. - TL;DR), if you like unique, challenging puzzle games and/or have a soft spot for music, get this game.  I dare say you won't be disappointed.  I would love to see a sequel or some additional puzzles available as *gulp* DLC.

12475423.review:
[h1]Vale cada centavo. 7.8/10[/h1]

Con un estilo simple y una interfaz minimalista, Circuits hace gala de su simplicidad.
Teniendo como único objetivo la combinación de ritmos y tonos para conseguir una melodía predeterminada, a través de 25 niveles/canciones que debemos completar, Circuits incrementa su dificultad de manera gradual, pero sin llegar a ser desesperante. Creando una armonía entre hermosos sonidos y ritmos que generan un atmósfera relajante. Entre muchos juegos parecidos (Auditorium, Musaic Box) Circuits es definitivamente el mejor entre ellos.

Un juego dedicado a los amantes de la música, todo dentro de Circuits la involucra, teniendo que escuchar atentamente cada pista presentada de manera que debemos reproducirla a la perfección, arrastrando sonidos, y ritmos, creando loops y repeticiones hasta conseguir la perfecta melodía.

[h1]Pros: [/h1] [list]
[*]Temática original.
[*]Soundtrack impresionante.
[*]Precio reducido.
[*]Creador de canciones. (Próximamente) [/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1] [list]
[*]Como puzzle puede llegar a ser muy simple.
[*]El juego solo cuenta con 25 niveles.
[*]Solo tiene un modo de juego. [/list]

[h1]Conclusión:[/h1] Aún con su reducida duración, Circuits es un juego totalmente recomendable, Su música es maravillosa y relajante. Su estilo es único y simple, una perfecta recomendación para amantes de la música y del genero.

[url=http://spoileverything.wordpress.com/2014/11/14/review-circuits-puzzle-musical/] Análisis en Spoil Everything [/url]

Análisis basado en una copia digital del juego para Steam, facilitada por Digital Tentacle.

12331352.review:
Juego de un genero puzzle y encima musical. ¿Qué más se puede pedir? Ya me he pasado varios niveles para poder sacarle sus cosas buenas como malas:

Puntos positivos
------------------

-Original. Y es que estamos acostumbrados a resolver puzzles visuales y mentales, pero musicales muy pocos. Yo como amante de la música agradezco a los desarroladores este juego.
-Barato. Si se pilla de oferta puedes tenerlo por menos de un euro. Cosa más que amortizable si vendes los cromos.
-Buena música. Un aplauso al compositor.
-Visulamente es bonito.
-Mecanica sencilla. Cansado de los juegos donde es más dificil aprender los controles que resolver los problemas mentales.

Puntos negativos
-------------------

-Breve. Con apenas 25 niveles mi cuerpo pide una segunda parte o si acaso, una expansión.


Analizando al origanlidad, el precio, la brevedad y la música utilizada... 7,5/10

12286127.review:
This game was pretty good.  I enjoyed the music and concept of the game.

Now to list the problem me and a friend had.  It was the randoming of the node placements.  You see, every time you replay a level, the audio nodes at the bottom are randomly shuffled.  Because of this, you cannot make an actual solution guide to the game.  You have to basically listen to everything and begin a trial and error method of solving.  While this seems okay for the first few levels, in later levels, you deal with as many as 16+ nodes, and hearing the same 2-3 seconds gets grating.

I spent nearly an hour trying to solve level 24 because too many of the audio nodes sound too much the same.  I eventually took my headphones off as I just couldn't stand it much more.  I feel that the game should automatically give you hints on what pieces are wrong and/or why its incorrect after you play back a song, as the limited hintings some of the levels give just don't help that greatly.

My original rating of this game was 90% but I have to drop it down to 60% because I expected the game to be more relaxing, and not hair-pulling frustation.  While you do get the OST with the game, it is kinda difficult to fully recommend the game.  However, the price is pretty good.  If you have an hour to pass, this could fill the time.

11928654.review:
A short puzzle game where the puzzle pieces are segments of music. It's not very long; I beat the whole game in around 3 hours (as you can see). For the most part, it's not that hard, either, unless you're trying to get the "Golden Ear" achievement (which requires you to complete every level without separating the song into individual layers). Speaking of achievements, I managed to get all but three in my first playthrough - and one of those three was an achievement for skipping 5 levels...

That said, though this game might be short, it is surprisingly challenging in the final few levels; you can't separate the last two levels into layers, so it's all up to your ability to listen carefully and pick out the different layers yourself. Music lovers in particular will almost certainly enjoy this game. (...Though I was not a fan of some of the electronic/dubstep songs.)

If it's on sale, I'd recommend checking it out. I just wish there were community-made levels or something so I could get more replay value out of it.

EDIT: ...And now, 3 hours later, I've beaten the game again (...well, the first 23 out of 25 levels, at least) and gotten the "Golden Ear" achievement (the other two took about a minute or less each). And it wasn't particularly annoying to do it over again - just challenging, especially on the later levels.

11900991.review:
As someone who loves music - in particular mixing/dj-ing electronic dance music of varying genres - Circuits immediately appealed to me. After playing a good amount of Sequence, this was a perfect follow-up game. This is a FANTASTIC game to play if you want to train/hone your ears for tone/pitch identification, or even just improve your music listening skills.

If you like circuit-based puzzles, music arrangement (in particular, EDM-style), and reconstructing song beats, you will really love this game.

The aesthetics are simple, but good - the theme seems to revolve around cell reproduction (as seen in the level titles and accompanying symbols/pictures). The music and sounds - which are central to the gameplay - are very, very good, and recreating a beat is extremely fun to listen to. 

The controls are simple - everything is done with your mouse. The tutorials are very quick and helpful, and new ones are given whenever a new mechanic is introduced. The learning curve ranges from minimal to moderate, primarily depending on your knowledge in musical theory, or at least identifying different notes/chords/pitches. If you play an instrument or dabble in sound/music creation, you should have an easier time with this game. Even for people not well-versed in music, however, there is a layer system that allows you to isolate similar sounds and listen to them separately from the rest of the track - making completion of the levels a lot easier.

For the achievement junkies, the achievements in Circuits are not too difficult to complete (without walkthroughs), however, the most challenging one is easily the "do not switch layers for any of the levels (except level 3, where it is mandatory)" goal - this requires you to actually LISTEN to each note being played. I spent upwards of fifteen minutes on a level just to get a correct solution. There are not too many levels, however, the game remains reasonably long (except if you are a musical virtuoso).

The gameplay is really fun and gets progressively more and more challenging. To begin, you are given a circuit track and a bunch of sound nodes. You can play the entire track sample that you need to replicate as many times as you like, and can also jump to any part of the sample (it will show you where in the circuit the track currently is at all times). Next, you must take the nodes you are given and arrange them on the circuit to replicate the sample track. The slots for the nodes are already provided for you, however, you must distinguish which node correctly goes into which slot. Nodes have different colors and initially arranged based on type. 

You can click on each node to play its sound, and you can place them into the background in order to arrange them based on tone/pitch (this is highly recommended). 

Later, you will have to do more advanced things like loop different nodes for x times (1-8). Further through the game, you will even have to loop entire sets of nodes. One tricky mechanic you will encounter later is path switching, where different pathways of the circuit are available, however, only specific pathways are correct. Furthermore, when you listen to the sample track, the visual aid of where the circuit is going will NOT tell you which pathway is correct. Overall, the difficulty progression is very well-done, and the game always remains fairly challenging.

Wonderful game for people into music, especially if you enjoy mixing/creating arrangements. Definitely check it out if this type of gameplay interests you.

Highly recommend!

Cheers,
DJSF [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/djsfsroguereviews]@DJSF's Rogue Reviews[/url]

[b]В итоге:  7,5/10[/b] Интересная музыкальня игра, но неразнообразная совершенно. Тем не менее, поиграть в неё несколько часов никому не помешает =^.^=

If you like the idea of creating music out of audio samples with programs such as Fruity Loops, Reason and ACID then you might like the mechanics of this puzzle game. The user is presented with a circuit diagram and a number of different audio samples which must be placed in the correct spots along with the use of a few different mechanics (repeat, loops, switches) in order to reproduce a 15 to 30 second song. There are 25 levels in total which I was able to finish in about 4 hours.

The aesthetic of the user interface is spartan which I personally liked. I had mixed feelings about the music. I liked certain parts of each song, but I can only say that I actually liked about 5 out of the 25 songs in their entirety. A lot of the songs make liberal use of the vocoder, which is something that I absolutely detest in any music. Having to listen to those particular samples multiple times in order to place them correctly was unpleasant for me.

I enjoyed my time with this game for the most part, but I do not feel the urge to go back and redo any of the puzzles.
